directories.name: 94_type_information_for_instructions_and_operands
directories.description: Typed instructions must have a type-size modifier. For example, the `add` instruction requires type and size information to properly perform the addition operation (signed, unsigned, float, different sizes), and this information must be specified as a suffix to the opcode.

directories.name: 96_semantics
directories.description: The goal of the semantic description of an instruction is to describe the results in all cases in as simple language as possible. The semantics are described using C, until C is not expressive enough.
